replies.bodyText: It is not really necessary but is there because the checks in EmailAccount only looks at unread mails and so the mail is marked as read after the test to reduce the searching.
replies.author: jtankw3

timeline.bodyText: Is it feasible to also check the content (or a subset of) of the file?
timeline.author: wkurniawan07
wkurniawan07

timeline.bodyText: What are all these waits for?
timeline.author: wkurniawan07

replies.bodyText: It is actually for the animation time when the tables are created. I have changed to using the waitUntilAnimationFinish method that someone else wrote.

timeline.bodyText: This works, but we don't really need to do a full check (otherwise we need to also maintain these test files). Just doing a quick sanity check (file name and maybe a few representative lines) is good enough.

timeline.bodyText: I have seen a lot of this kind of operation, and it's not just on this PR. Is it possible to build some kind of abstraction for them? Or perhaps use the RetryManager class? But don't need to do on this PR.

timeline.bodyText: Maybe use retries here, where the success condition is the existence of downloaded file?
